p: On the herbal ethnobotanical side, changes in medicinal plant use in Estonia between 1888 and 1994 showed that the use of garlic, hose chestnuts and mint increased, whereas the use of barley, orchids, Paris quadrifolia and Briza media significantlyÂ decreased [ 23], thus supporting the idea that during the past century the utilization of plants depending on human influence was remarkably amplified.
